Welcome to rest api’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like connecting to databases or initializing external APIs.

Returns:

A fastapilimiter instance

REST API repository Contacts¶

src.repository.contacts.create_contact(db: Session, contact: ContactCreate, user: User) → Contact¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object. contact (ContactCreate): The ContactCreate schema model to be created in the database. user (User): The User schema model that is creating this contact, used for foreign key relationship with contacts table.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • contact – ContactCreate: Create a new contact

  • user – User: Get the user id from the user object

Returns:

The newly created contact

src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, user: User) → Contact¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

db (Session): The database session to use for querying. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete. user (User): The user who is deleting the contact.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to delete

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is authorized to delete the contact

Returns:

The deleted contact

src.repository.contacts.get_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, user: User) → Contact¶

The get_contact function takes in a database session, contact_id, and user. It then queries the database for a Contact with the given id and user_id. If it finds one, it returns that Contact object.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is logged in and has access to the contact

Returns:

A contact object

src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_with_birthdays(db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_with_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next week.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

Returns:

A list of contact objects

src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(db: Session, query: str, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • query – str: Search for a contact by first name, last name or email

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the query

src.repository.contacts.update_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, user: User) → Contact¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • contact_id – int: Find the contact in the database

  • contact – ContactUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to update their own contacts

Returns:

The updated contact

REST API repository Users¶

src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session. It then gets the user by their email, sets their confirmed status to True, and commits the changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

None

src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Define the data that will be used to create a new user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object, which is a row in the users table

src.repository.users.update_password(user: User, new_password: str, db: Session)¶

The update_password function takes in a user object, new_password string, and db session. It then updates the password of the user object to be equal to the new_password string. Finally it commits this change to the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify that the user parameter is of type user

  • new_password – str: Pass in the new password to be set

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

None

src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user

  • token – Optional[str]: Pass in the token that is returned from the spotify api

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_with_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(query: str = Query(None), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information. It uses the auth_service to get the current user, and then returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a User object, which is obtained from the auth_service module’s get_current_user function. Finally it takes in a Session object, which is obtained from the get_db function defined above.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user’s information

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated user object

REST API routes Auth¶

src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routes.auth.request_reset_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routes.auth.show_reset_password_form(token: str, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routes.auth.update_password(token: str, new_password: str = Form(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
